alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 7:42AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SECOND RELEASE ON MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER HAS STARTED... GAGE DATA AND IMAGERY FROM SUICIDE BASIN INDICATE THAT A SECOND RELEASE FROM THAT BASIN HAS STARTED. WATER LEVELS IN THE BASIN WERE ESTIMATED TO BE ABOUT A QUARTER AS HIGH AS WHAT WAS OBSERVED AT THE START OF THE PRIMARY RELEASE EARLIER THIS MONTH. IF THE BASIN RELEASES ALL OF ITS WATER THE MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER ARE STILL EXPECTED TO REMAIN WITHIN THEIR BANKS WITH A CREST OF AROUND 7.6 FEET (BELOW THE FLOOD STAGE OF 9.0 FEET) ON THE MENDENHALL LAKE GAGE MONDAY MORNING. WE DO NOT KNOW IF ALL THE WATER IN THE BASIN WILL RELEASE, NOR EXACTLY HOW MUCH WATER IS IN THE BASIN. SO EXPECTED CREST HEIGHT AND TIMING MAY VARY FROM THE FORECAST.
